page.title: 14Nosehill & KinetonHill Farms
page.content: Previously known as Barton Farm, this farm was bought from and re-sold to the quarry owners in the last 25 years. The farmhouse is empty, the land being quarried right up to the garden wall. The previous owner farms adjoining land using the farm buildings at Nosehill. He is also growing cereal crops on topsoil laid on the quarry floor. Cows with calves graze land near the quarry, and a cattle shed is built within the quarry. Kineton Hill Farm is the home of the Sydenham Stud Welsh Cobs. Foals have been exported to 9 different countries. 4 mares and 15 visiting mares are kept. There are 3 stallions. Cattle and 50 Jacob sheep are kept on 26 hectares. Lambs are sold fat or kept for showing and breeding. Wool is sold for spinning.
